headline.seo: Questions Surround Teixeira and Sabathia for Yankees

docs.snippet: The Yankees still count on Mark Teixeira and C. C. Sabathia three years after they helped the team win the World Series. But neither, for the moment, is quite the same....
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that the New York Yankees continue to count on first baseman Mark Teixeira and pitcher C C Sabathia three years after they helped the team win the World Series in 2009, but acknowledges that both have been hampered by injuries.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees still count on Mark Teixeira and C. C. Sabathia three years after they helped the team win the World Series. But neither, for the moment, is quite the same.

headline.seo: Gangnam Style Video Gets North Korean Propaganda Treatment

docs.snippet: A South Korean phenomenon behind a dance video called “Gangnam Style” got an even clearer sign of success when North Korea parodied the video....
docs.abstract: North Korea makes a propaganda video that parodies South Korean singer Park Jae-sang's viral dance video, confirming Park's ubiquitous international popularity.

byline.contributor: Jeffery DelViscio and Shreeya Sinha contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: A South Korean phenomenon behind a dance video called “Gangnam Style” got an even clearer sign of success when North Korea parodied the video.

headline.seo: Youth Fatally Stabbed Outside His High School in Manhattan

docs.snippet: Officials said Theodore Beckles, 19, was stabbed outside Independence High School on West 56th Street during an argument with other students....
docs.abstract: Theodore Beckles, a student at Independence High School on West 56th Street in Manhattan, dies after being stabbed outside the school during an argument with other students; the nature of the argument is not disclosed, and no arrests have been made.
docs.lead_paragraph: Officials said Theodore Beckles, 19, was stabbed outside Independence High School on West 56th Street during an argument with other students.

headline.main: Gangnam Style, Original and in Imitation

docs.snippet: “Gangnam Style,” a music video by a South Korean rapper known as PSY, has been viewed over a billion times on YouTube. It’s also been redone by motivated fans in video imitations as over the top as the original....
docs.lead_paragraph: “Gangnam Style,” a music video by a South Korean rapper known as PSY, has been viewed over a billion times on YouTube. It’s also been redone by motivated fans in video imitations as over the top as the original.

headline.print_headline: Canadian Auto Workers Union And G.M. Agree on Contract
headline.seo: Canadian Auto Workers Union Reaches Deal With General Motors
headline.main: Canadian Auto Workers Union and G.M. Agree on Contract

docs.snippet: The Canadian Auto Workers Union agreed on a tentative contract with General Motors, but said that it was still in talks with Chrysler....
docs.abstract: Canadian Auto Workers Union agrees on a tentative contract with General Motors, but says it is still in talks with Chrysler.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian Auto Workers Union agreed on a tentative contract with General Motors, but said that it was still in talks with Chrysler.

headline.seo: Reeling Mets Hit Bottom in Loss to Phillies

docs.snippet: To make a miserable night complete, the Mets’ loss to Phildelphia on Thursday mathematically eliminated them from playoff contention....
docs.abstract: Philadelphia Phillies rout the New York Mets, 16-1, mathematically eliminating them from playoff contention.
docs.lead_paragraph: To make a miserable night complete, the Mets’ loss to Phildelphia on Thursday mathematically eliminated them from playoff contention.

headline.print_headline: Daunting Path Greets Romney Before Debates
headline.main: Before Debates, Romney Faces a Daunting Path

docs.snippet: There are 46 days left in this presidential race for Mitt Romney to change the dynamic of a campaign that by many indicators is tilting against him....
docs.abstract: Political Memo; Mitt Romney has 46 days left in the presidential race to change the dynamic of a campaign that by many indicators is tilting against him; state-by-state landscape facing him is more daunting than he expected by this stage; burden rests his ability to restore confidence to his campaign and clearly explain to voters why he is the better choice to repair the economy and lead the nation in addressing its challenges at home and abroad.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and JIM RUTENBERG

docs.lead_paragraph: There are 46 days left in this presidential race for Mitt Romney to change the dynamic of a campaign that by many indicators is tilting against him.

headline.print_headline: After Injury and Years of Rejection, Giants’ Brown Embraces His Chance
headline.seo: Giants’ Andre Brown Embraces His Chance After Years of Disappointment
headline.main: After Years of Disappointment, Giants’ Brown Embraces His Chance

docs.snippet: Andre Brown ruptured his Achilles’ tendon in 2009 and was waived by five teams, but with the injury to Giants’ starting tailback Ahmad Bradshaw, Brown finally has a chance to rush in the N.F.L....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andre Brown ruptured his Achilles’ tendon in 2009 and was waived by five teams, but with the injury to Giants’ starting tailback Ahmad Bradshaw, Brown finally has a chance to rush in the N.F.L.

headline.print_headline: Hoping to Replace Mayor, And Taking Him to Court
headline.main: Hoping to Replace Mayor, and Taking Him to Court

docs.snippet: Likely candidates for the 2013 Democratic primary are vying for attention and to demonstrate how much they differ with Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, by suing him....
docs.abstract: Two likely contenders in the 2013 Democratic primary for New York City mayor--public advocate Bill de Blasio and City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn--have separately filed lawsuits against the Bloomberg administration; such legal maneuvers can help candidates get attention and differentiate themselves from Mayor Bloomberg on key policy issues.
docs.lead_paragraph: Likely candidates for the 2013 Democratic primary are vying for attention and to demonstrate how much they differ with Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, by suing him.
